Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The magnitude of transformation of the microglia assessed by the number of intersections was significantly higher in the PDN groups than in controls in the prefrontal cortex ( moderate - dose , 24 . 1 ; high - dose , 23 . 6 ; controls 18 . 7 ; p < 0 . 01 ) and striatum ( moderate - dose 25 . 6 ; high - dose 26 . 3 ; controls 18 . 9 ; p < 0 . 01 ) , but not in hippocampus .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| PDN |
| moderate-dose |
| high-dose |
| controls |

The paragraph mentions "PDN" (which presumably stands for "Parkinson's disease") and refers to "moderate-dose" and "high-dose" groups in the context of PDN. Therefore, these entities can be considered as related to the disease. However, "controls" is not a disease entity, but rather a term used to refer to a control group in an experiment.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| PDN |
| moderate-dose PDN |
| high-dose PDN |

The entities that were removed were "controls" because it does not clearly refer to a disease. The term "controls" is used to refer to a control group in an experiment, and it is not a disease entity.

The remaining entities, "PDN", "moderate-dose PDN", and "high-dose PDN" clearly refer to the disease entity "Parkinson's disease" and its different dosages.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The magnitude of transformation of the microglia assessed by the number of intersections was significantly higher in the PDN groups than in controls in the prefrontal cortex ( moderate - dose , 24 . 1 ; high - dose , 23 . 6 ; controls 18 . 7 ; p < 0 . 01 ) and striatum ( moderate - dose 25 . 6 ; high - dose 26 . 3 ; controls 18 . 9 ; p < 0 . 01 ) , but not in hippocampus .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| PDN |
| moderate-dose |
| high-dose |
| controls |

Explanation:

* PDN (para-dinitrophenol) is a chemical compound.
* Moderate-dose and high-dose refer to different concentrations of PDN.
* Controls refer to a group of samples that did not receive PDN treatment.

Note that the numbers following each dose (e.g., 24.1, 23.6, 18.7) are not chemical entities, but rather numerical values indicating the magnitude of transformation assessed in the respective groups.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| PDN |
| moderate-dose |
| high-dose |

Explanation:

* PDN (para-dinitrophenol) is a chemical compound.
* Moderate-dose and high-dose refer to different concentrations of PDN.

The entities "controls" and the numerical values (e.g., 24.1, 23.6, 18.7) do not clearly refer to chemical entities and were removed from the table.
